response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "high", "Being 21 years old places the individual in a high-risk category as younger offenders generally have higher recidivism rates."],
    ["Gender", "medium", "Male offenders statistically exhibit a moderately higher risk of recidivism."],
    ["Ethnicity", "low", "Hispanic identity in itself is not a strong risk factor, so it is considered low risk."],
    ["Criminal History", "medium", "Having one arrest and conviction elevates risk modestly, though it is not an extensive criminal record."],
    ["Living Situation", "medium", "Living alone can indicate lower social support, moderately increasing recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital Status", "medium", "Never being married is associated with slightly higher risk due to potential lack of social ties."],
    ["Education", "medium", "A high school diploma without enrollment in further education suggests limited opportunities, posing a moderate risk factor."],
    ["Employment", "high", "Not having held a job during the past year is a significant risk factor, indicating economic instability."],
    ["Substance Use", "medium", "Recent marijuana use contributes to recidivism risk moderately, even though it is less severe than harder drugs."],
    ["Mental Health", "low", "Not feeling depressed is a protective factor, indicating low risk in this area."],
    ["Family Background", "high", "Growing up in a large, urban household of 10 may indicate chaotic or less focused supervision, which is a high-risk element."],
    ["Religious Belief", "low", "Belief that God influences personal outcomes can act as a protective factor, associated with lower risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 80
}

risk_factors: Being 21 years old places the individual in a high-risk category as younger offenders generally have higher recidivism rates.
Male offenders statistically exhibit a moderately higher risk of recidivism.
Hispanic identity in itself is not a strong risk factor, so it is considered low risk.
Having one arrest and conviction elevates risk modestly, though it is not an extensive criminal record.
Living alone can indicate lower social support, moderately increasing recidivism risk.
Never being married is associated with slightly higher risk due to potential lack of social ties.
A high school diploma without enrollment in further education suggests limited opportunities, posing a moderate risk factor.
Not having held a job during the past year is a significant risk factor, indicating economic instability.
Recent marijuana use contributes to recidivism risk moderately, even though it is less severe than harder drugs.
Not feeling depressed is a protective factor, indicating low risk in this area.
Growing up in a large, urban household of 10 may indicate chaotic or less focused supervision, which is a high-risk element.
Belief that God influences personal outcomes can act as a protective factor, associated with lower risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as Hispanic. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 8 inches and weighs 165 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 10, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
